Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2009 06:43PM momgovero wrote: I went on the FACEBOOK site. I start the 12 weeks of weekly treatments of Taxol and Herceptin March 25th.  I have already had 12 weeks of FEC.  No surgery yet.  My onc says 12 weeks of FEC, followed by 12 weeks of Paclitaxol and Herceptin, then masectomy in early July.  They haven't mentioned radiation yet.  I am going to Siteman Cancer Center in St. Louis.
Posts.Title: **NEW** Starting Chemo March 2009 ginagina celia088

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2009 02:28PM momgovero wrote: Hi there girls!  I just got back from my "mark-ups" appointment.  I had my mastectomy (right side) with lymhnodes (clear) June 26th, 2009. It was more "uncomfortable" than I thought.  I am 52, and my arms hurt to hold them in that position for that long.  Once they let me move them, it took me a few minutes to just move them!  Ouch!!  Anyway, I am marked up like a road map.  No way to conceal the marks, unless I wear a turtle neck!!  I am leaving for Florida in 3 days to take my mom to her timeshare for 2 weeks.  They told me to "try and stay out of the water and protect these marks."  If I do go into the water, try and stay only waist deep.  Yeah right.  I have been on this path since New Year's Eve.  Chemo, mastectomy, now radiation.  I am guessing we will be doing this again when I get back, because I am going in the water!!  I need the hot tub, I need the pool, and I need the waves and salt water!!
Posts.Title: October Rads. 2009 PauldingMom linn56

Posts.Content: May 7, 2009 09:29AM momgovero wrote: when I began to lose my hair, I let my 18 year old give me a mohawk!  It lets them see that I am ok with this journey, and realize it is just a journey that we all will have to walk together.  But, my oncologist shared with me a story to share with them.  Their grandpa just died of Leukemia, December 2007, so the word cancer scares them (kids) as well as us.  He said this cancer is an elephant, huge.  This cancer, breast cancer, is a mouse.  Although they are both mammals, they both have hair, they both are warm blooded, they both have 4 legs, they have similarities.  But, that is about where the similarities stop.  It takes a lot more to kill an elephant, more powerful stuff, and sometimes we can't.  But, breast cancer is a mouse....it don't take much to kill a mouse.  We will kill this.  We will fix you, and you will dance at your 4 year old's wedding!!  I promise you.
